courses.customDesc: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5 and F. C4, D5 and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D3, D4, D5 or F.

A maximum of 16 units of elective credit may be required for the major to reach the 180 unit requirement to graduate. Excess units of AP Test credit may be applied to elective credit. The Chemistry Department strongly recommends taking CHEM 101 (1) in your first quarter. Also, it is suggested that you take supplemental workshops (SCM 150) along with available Math/Science courses in your first year.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5 and F. A maximum of 16 units of elective credit may be required for the major to reach the 180 unit requirement to graduate. Excess units of AP Test credit may be applied to elective credit. The Chemistry Department strongly recommends taking CHEM 101 (1) in your first quarter. Also, it is suggested that you take supplemental workshops (SCM 150) along with available Math/Science courses in your first year.

Select 12 units from Advanced Biochemistry Electives. This is the default curriculum for students who do not declare a concentration. At least two courses must be chosen from List A (see catalog), including one lecture. Consult with advisor.
